name: sfchronicle
text:
Since the coronavirus pandemic began, officials say the Governor's Office of Emergency Services has delivered:

• 45.8 million N95 masks
• 55.3 million surgical masks
• 19.5 million gloves
• 4.3 million face shields
• 1.5 million surgical gowns
https://t.co/YYGX4f4goP

text: A San Leandro woman was arrested Friday on suspicion of posting racist messages on the doors of homes. The messages suggested that people "not native to America" leave the country immediately, police said. https://t.co/i9ZDIcVN2V

name: sfchronicle
text:
Can families travel anywhere this summer? 
Can kids see their grandparents or play with their friends? 
And what about wearing masks while exercising? 

Doctors offer real-world guidance and practical tips as society, like businesses, slowly reopens.
https://t.co/XhTM84t51j

text: How do you celebrate Memorial Day in a pandemic? Bay Area officials are warning against people taking holiday weekend drives. Leisure travel will not reopen until the state enters Phase 3 and no timeline has been given for that. https://t.co/bae61zhMxN

Gov. Newsom didn’t pick just any restaurant to announce that the state was preparing to allow dine-in restaurants and offices to reopen in some counties, writes @PhilMatier. He picked Mustards Grill in Napa Valley.
https://t.co/ELDbXqKcbp

name: sfchronicle
text:
Coronavirus Updates: White House economic adviser Kevin Hassett said the U.S. unemployment rate may reach “north of 20%” in May. That rate will spike even higher in June before it begins to trend downward, Hassett told CNN Sunday. 

https://t.co/U9MtLbmixa

text:

Then that decision was rethought, columnist @philmatier reports:

 https://t.co/lNq4GFvlRp

name: sfchronicle
text: With offices shuttered across the world by the coronavirus, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg has said up to half of the company’s employees, which total 48,000, could work remotely within 10 years. He said the move should "help spread economic opportunity." https://t.co/lxuZPfUKrj

https://t.co/FpKs37HSoS
